conclusion: Determine the pressure exerted by the top sphere (D) on the bottom three spheres (A, B, and C) when stacked in a cone shape.
Spheres are homogeneous with uniform mass distribution and placed on a smooth horizontal surface.
Four spheres with mass m and radius r; bottom three spheres (A, B, and C) in a triangular formation; sphere D on top forming a tetrahedral arrangement.
Centers of spheres A, B, and C form an equilateral triangle; sphere D is above the centroid of this triangle.
Sphere D exerts a force due to its weight on the three spheres below it.
Weight of sphere D is given by mg, where g is the acceleration due to gravity.
Force exerted by sphere D is evenly distributed among spheres A, B, and C due to symmetry.
Each of the bottom spheres (A, B, and C) will experience one-third of the weight of sphere D.
Pressure is defined as force per unit area; interested in force exerted by sphere D on the three spheres.
Force exerted by sphere D on each of the spheres A, B, and C is mg/3.
Pressure (force) of sphere D on each of the spheres A, B, and C is mg/3.
